title: 820-3330-b NO BACKLIGHT
message: I have 820-3330-b 17 inch MacBook woth no water damage but physical damage i hear the chime and i light up the apple on the back with flash light to make sure is backlight issue and the computer is booting in OS. I check the F9700 was blown i replace it and after that Q9706 got burned smoke came out. So i remove F9700 and started measuring i've noticed that LCD_BKLT_EN is missing and when i follow that line takes me to U9600 GMUX and i dont even know how this thing work. Any Ideas ???

title: 820-3330-b NO BACKLIGHT
message: You have a short on the backlight output. Probably burned connector or cable. Q9706 fried because you replaced the fuse with a wire or more than 3A.

title: 820-3330-b NO BACKLIGHT
message: When i put wire on the fuse, computer wouldn't start anymore. I remove the wire and its working again

title: 820-3330-b NO BACKLIGHT
message: R9788 Is 0.00001 ohms i got another that i measured 300k i put it on motherboard and I measure again and i still get 0.00001 ohm. Any ideas I'm getting crazy. haha

title: 820-3330-b NO BACKLIGHT
message: R9788 measuring short is because Q9706 is dead. There is a short on the backlight output, measure it, who cares that connector and cable look good.

title: 820-3330-b NO BACKLIGHT
message: There is no information in that photo. Boot from a known good USB stick with 10.9 or later.
